labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

items.title: test(core): resolve pytest marker warning
items.body:
Remove redundant/outdated `@pytest.mark.requires("jinja2")` decorator

Pytest marks (like `@pytest.mark.requires(...)`) applied directly to fixtures have no effect and are deprecated.

items.title: test(core): resolve `pydantic_v1` deprecation warning
items.body:
Excluded pydantic_v1 module from import testing

Acceptable since this pydantic_v1 is explicitly deprecated. Testing its importability at this stage serves little purpose since users should migrate away from it.

items.title: refactor(core): use `aadd_documents` in vectorstores unit tests
items.body:
Don't use the deprecated `upsert()` and `aupsert()`

Instead use the recommended alternatives

items.title: test(core): use secure hash algorithm in indexing test to eliminate SHA-1 warning
test(core): suppress `pydantic_v1` deprecation warnings during import tests
items.body: We intentionally import these. Hide warnings to reduce testing noise.

items.title: test(core): don't use deprecated `input_variables` param in `from_file`
refactor(core): don't use deprecated `input_variables` param in `from_file`
items.body: Missed awhile back; causes warnings during tests

items.title: chore(infra): add tests to label mapping
test(core): suppress deprecation warnings in `PipelinePromptTemplate`
items.body: We're intentionally testing this still so as not to regress. Reduce warning noise.

items.title: fix(core): use secure hash algorithm in indexing test to eliminate SHA-1 warning
items.body: Use SHA-256 (collision-resistant) instead of the default SHA-1. No functional changes to test behavior.

items.title: test(core): enhance stringify_value test coverage for nested structures
items.body:
## Summary
Adds test coverage for the `stringify_value` utility function to handle complex nested data structures that weren't previously tested.

## Changes
- Added `test_stringify_value_nested_structures()` to `test_strings.py`
- Tests nested dictionaries within lists
- Tests mixed-type lists with various data types
- Verifies proper stringification of complex nested structures

## Why This Matters
- Fills a gap in test coverage for edge cases
- Ensures `stringify_value` handles complex data structures correctly  
- Improves confidence in string utility functions used throughout the codebase
- Low risk addition that strengthens existing test suite

## Testing
```bash
uv run --group test pytest libs/core/tests/unit_tests/utils/test_strings.py::test_stringify_value_nested_structures -v
```

This test addition follows the project's testing patterns and adds meaningful coverage without introducing any breaking changes.
